meanings.definition: (古英語) 子孫、血統、人種、家系
meanings.notes: This word is archaic and rarely used in modern English.

etymology.value: From Old English *strēon*, meaning 'procreation, gain, possession, treasure, offspring, race, stock'. Related to *strīenan* 'to beget, acquire'.

usage_notes.explanation: 'Streyne' is an obsolete word, primarily found in historical texts or literature attempting to evoke an archaic style. It refers to ancestry or descendants.

readability_explanation.text: This is an archaic word and would only be encountered in very old texts. It is not used in modern English.
